'''Shagrat''' was an [[Uruk-hai
column2: Uruk]] commanding the garrison of the [[Tower of Cirith Ungol]] during the [[War of the Ring]].

column1: ==History==

During a patrol to [[Shelob's Lair]], Shagrat's company encountered a troop of Orcs from [[Minas Morgul]] led by [[Gorbag]]. The two did not get along, but before things escalated, they noted something out of place: a [[Frodo Baggins
column2: strange small creature]], all wound up in [[Shelob]]'s webs. The discovery of what appeared to be an undersized [[Elves
column3: Elf]] led the two commanders to compare their notes; they concluded that there must have been another nearby. But they could not find this "great Elf warrior".

column1: Turmoil rose again amongst the group when Gorbag and Shagrat disagreed with what they had to do with the prisoner. Shagrat's orders from [[Sauron
column2: above]] were simple; all personal effects were to be sent to [[Barad-dûr]]. Shagrat did not trust many of his own troops, and none of Gorbag's, so he locked up the prisoner in the top chamber of the [[Tower of Cirith Ungol]].<ref>{{TT

column1: Gorbag coveted the ''[[Mithril]]'' shirt Frodo wore, and attempted to usurp Shagrat's rule. Though he was larger than his adversary, Gorbag lost to Shagrat's superior numbers. Soon, Gorbag's faction was pressed back. Shagrat eventually killed [[Gorbag]], and ran off to Sauron with the prisoner's belongings.<ref>{{RK
column2: Tower}}</ref> He did not reach Barad-dûr until four days later; Sauron killed him after he delivered the news of intruders.<ref>[[Wayne G. Hammond]], [[Christina Scull]], ''[[The Lord of the Rings: A Reader's Companion]]'', page 609</ref>
